Holy shit. Played both the first and this one back-to-back and now I understand why they are considered classics. While some test chambers were hard to figure up (what to do exactly) it was VERY rewarding when I managed to overcome those by myself. And the acting and NPCs are top-notch.

Short and sweet, lets test!

One of my first games that I bought for my now expansive Steam library, and I don't regret it one bit.

Portal 2 is the most recent game that Valve released in the past decade (Barring HL: Alyx) and is easy recommendation to me. Its singleplayer campaign has a great story and memorable characters. The co-op campaign (co-op campaign!!) is a unique experience with a playtime of 20 hours with uncooperative friends.

The puzzles are intuitive and work just as the physics of the game allow them to 99.8% of the time, allowing even the most nooby of video game players to pick it up and play with some encouragement.

2012 was a great year for video games, and this was one of the best games of that year.
And... it's $2.00 on sale.

Se tivesse um filme

Oh my God. This game, along with the original Portal, is a must have for anyone who has Steam. It has such a great story mode that you could play over and over again, and on top of that, it has a multiplayer epilogue AND a community level maker that is still very active with almost no signs of slowing down, creating countless hours of gameplay. I can't say enough about this game! The characters are so likable, the story's amazing, the humor is top-tier, it's full of easter eggs and it's 1000 times better when you play the original Portal first, since there are references to the original's levels in the first chapter. Every time E3 comes around I hope to God that Portal 3 gets announced!

Vraiment un jeu de fou. J'ai jamais rien vu de comparable. Juste les musiques un peu bof et assez inutiles. Sinon tout le reste, l'humour direct au top, le scénario, les énigmes ni trop dures ni trop "les joueurs sont des simplets". J'ai toujours entendu, lu, du bien de ce jeu mais oui il est vraiment anthologique.
